<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LAW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/20/ginsburg-death-spell-trouble-affordable-care-act?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Now for the Supreme Court?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Supreme Court" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NTgvc3VwcmVtZV9jb3VydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Liberal Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/19/ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-87?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died</a> on Friday night at 87. As a feminist icon and revered jurist, RBG's death was devastating for many, but it <a href="https://www.vox.com/21446256/ruth-bader-ginsburg-death-supreme-court-obamacare-case?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also raised</a> some cold hard political questions about the court’s future makeup. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Ginsburg’s death leaves the court with five conservative-leaning justices and three liberal ones. President Trump <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/sep/20/trump-vows-to-nominate-a-woman-for-us-supreme-court-vacancy-within-a-week?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> Saturday that he’ll nominate a replacement this week. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has promised a confirmation vote. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Democrats responded with a resounding “Oh, that’s rich,” pointing to McConnell’s refusal in 2016 to hold a hearing for then-President Barack Obama’s nominee, Merrick Garland, because it was an election year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump has pledged to nominate a woman—possibly Amy Coney Barrett, Barbara Lagoa, or Allison Jones Rushing, according to reports. You can read up on them <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/09/19/trump-supreme-court-candidates-418366?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">One upcoming case looms especially large: The ACA </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Aka Obamacare. On Nov. 10, one week after the election, the Supreme Court will hear oral arguments in a lawsuit against the healthcare law—a group of Republican-led states is trying to get the ACA thrown out. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Their argument? A provision in the 2017 tax cuts repealed the ACA’s individual mandate penalty (the fine for not having health insurance), so they argue the whole enchilada should be thrown out on grounds of unconstitutionality. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Even if Trump announces an appointee ASAP, it’s unlikely she’ll be confirmed and robed up by the 10th. So with an eight-justice court, a 4-4 tie is possible, in which case it’ll be sent back to lower courts. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Biden campaign is adding the ACA fight to its healthcare-forward message, focusing on Trump’s handling of the pandemic and Biden’s role in getting the ACA passed in the first place. Democratic operatives <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/19/us/politics/joe-biden-supreme-court-ginsburg.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">say</a> healthcare was a winning issue in the 2018 midterms and has only become more potent now that every stray cough is cause for concern. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F20%2Fginsburg-death-spell-trouble-affordable-care-act" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/20/trump-gives-blessing-oraclewalmarttiktok-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TikTok Will Live on, After All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TikTok " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDczL3Rpa3Rvay5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, President Trump gave his “<a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/09/20/914032065/tiktok-ban-averted-trump-gives-oracle-walmart-deal-his-blessing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blessing</a>” to the marriage of TikTok and major U.S. corporations Oracle and Walmart. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Oracle and Walmart will reportedly take a combined 20% stake in the new company, TikTok Global. ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese owner and the main character in this drama, is expected to keep 80%...but American interests control 40% of ByteDance, so the new company will have <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/19/trump-says-he-has-approved-tiktok-oracle-deal-in-concept.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">majority U.S. ownership</a>, per the Trump administration.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But Trump's original demand for ByteDance to sell TikTok's U.S. operations over national security concerns </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/20/technology/tiktok-trump-victory.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>isn't </em>happening</a></span><span>, which leaves some critics asking..."what was the point of all this again?" </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Oracle and Walmart are happy: </strong>Oracle will get a big boost to its cloud business, which has lagged rivals like Amazon. Walmart will flex its e-commerce muscles to TikTok’s 100 million monthly active U.S. users.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>the Commerce Department delayed its order to ban TikTok from U.S. app stores. The other Chinese app under fire, WeChat, was also <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-wechat/u-s-judge-blocks-commerce-department-order-to-remove-wechat-from-app-stores-idUSKCN26B0IY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">saved</a> from an app store ban by a judge yesterday. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F20%2Ftrump-gives-blessing-oraclewalmarttiktok-deal" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/21/report-concludes-banks-shuffled-allegedly-dirty-money-around-globe?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Walter White's Car Wash Has Nothing on This
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Top global banks shuffled huge sums of allegedly illicit funds around the globe even after noticing irregularities, according to an <a href="https://www.icij.org/investigations/fincen-files/what-is-the-fincen-files-investigation/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigation</a> dropped yesterday by *deep breath* the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ), BuzzFeed News, and more than 100 media partners in 88 countries. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s a lot of journalistic horsepower, but this was a big operation. In a treasure trove of leaked government documents, the investigators found at least $2 trillion worth of transactions were flagged as “suspicious” by banks’ internal compliance departments from 1999–2017. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Which banks? </strong>JPMorgan, HSBC, Standard Chartered Bank, Deutsche Bank, and Bank of New York Mellon were named in the report for shuffling dirty money around even after promising the government they’d keep a more careful eye on money laundering. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why you should care: </strong>“Because the free flow of illicit money causes incalculable harm,” writes the ICIJ, fueling drug cartels, enabling tax evasion, and helping oligarchs consolidate power. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This story requires much more real estate than one newsletter. </strong><a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/jasonleopold/fincen-files-financial-scandal-criminal-networks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read the report</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY TYPEFORM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</font></a>
</h1>

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And it’s about time. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People have used boring forms forever—whether it’s a survey to better understand customers, or a quiz to qualify leads.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But <a href="https://typeformsem.typeform.com/to/FJL9sY1W?utm_campaign=Sep21&utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=email&utm_content=MorningBrewPrimary1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Typeform</a> is here to tell you it doesn’t have to be that way. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With <strong style="color:#000">splashy backgrounds, engaging videos, and high-def photos</strong>, <a href="https://typeformsem.typeform.com/to/FJL9sY1W?utm_campaign=Sep21&utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=email&utm_content=MorningBrewPrimary1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Typeform’s UI</a> brings forms to life in a way that can actually make completing a form the highlight of your time on the internet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when people have a good time flowing through your form built with <a href="https://typeformsem.typeform.com/to/FJL9sY1W?utm_campaign=Sep21&utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=email&utm_content=MorningBrewPrimary1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Typeform</a>, they’re more likely to complete said form.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, Typeforms get <strong style="color:#000">18% more responses than other solutions</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Join the fight against traditional forms.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://typeformsem.typeform.com/to/FJL9sY1W?utm_campaign=Sep21&utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=email&utm_content=MorningBrewPrimary1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try Typeform today</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/20/las-vegas-raiders-make-home-debut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's No Caesars Palace, but It'll Do
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Aerial shot of Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDY3L2FsbGVnaWFudF9zdGFkaXVtLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ethan Miller/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tonight, another enormous, slightly-out-of-place-looking structure is set to open in Las Vegas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That would be Allegiant Stadium, the new $2 billion home of the Las Vegas Raiders. The Raiders will break in the stadium (nicknamed the “Death Star”) against the New Orleans Saints on <em>Monday Night Football.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Hosting an NFL team is a landmark moment for Las Vegas, which had a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/13/sports/football/oakland-raiders-las-vegas-stadium.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reputation</a> for being too tourism-centered and small to support a football franchise. But continued population growth and an up-and-coming tech industry mean it could be ready. The NHL and WNBA both added Vegas outposts in the last few years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s also a </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/dafc4bfa7f8e9b7796c52455d139df0d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historic moment</a></span><span> for the NFL, which had shunned any connection to sports betting. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The Raiders’ debut comes at a time when Las Vegas’s position atop the (legal) sports betting world is <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/new-jersey-passed-nevada-in-sports-betting-last-month-should-las-vegas-be-worried-2019-11-04?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">being challenged</a>. In several months last year, the total amount wagered in New Jersey topped the totals in Vegas.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Fed Chair Jerome Powell makes one of three appearances before Congressional committees  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Jobless claims; Costco earnings</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Chillen</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More Brew recs: </strong>If you like the recommendations we provide in the Brew’s Bets section, you should know we have an <em>entire newsletter</em> dedicated to tips on helping you live your best life, from recipes and workouts to TV recs and DIY inspo. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=nl&utm_campaign=042019&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out now</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>On Mondays, we present a relevant business topic, give you a few balanced resources, and encourage you to discuss with friends, family, and coworkers. </em><em><br></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week’s topic:</strong> In honor of the late Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, we’re talking about gender equality. Specifically, how women continue to shoulder a greater proportion of invisible labor. On an average day in 2019, 70% of U.S. women did food prep and cleanup, compared to 48% of men; 46% of women did household chores vs. 22% of men. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Understanding invisible labor. (</span><span><a href="https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/life/parenting/a32017759/invisible-labor-mothers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Good Housekeeping</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s not just at home: Women are more likely to take care of “office housework,” too. (</span><span><a href="https://qz.com/599999/at-work-as-at-home-men-reap-the-benefits-of-womens-invisible-labor/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quartz</a></span><span>) </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How the Covid-19 childcare crisis will distort the economy for a generation. (</span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/07/23/child-care-crisis-pandemic-economy-impact-women-380412?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Politico</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What about same-sex couples? (</span><span><a href="https://jezebel.com/surprise-same-sex-couples-are-better-at-chore-equality-1709390955?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jezebel</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some couples are using project management apps like Trello and Asana to more fairly divvy up household work. (</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/goodbye-honey-do-list-hello-shared-labor-app-11572949803?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/family/archive/2019/07/families-slack-asana/593584/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Audience participation:</strong> This week, we challenge you and your partner to log all the time you spend on household chores—shopping, cleaning, budgeting, childcare, etc.—then compare at the end of the week. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NTgvc3VwcmVtZV9jb3VydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePixabay\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLiberal Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/19/ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-87?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied\u003c/a\u003e on Friday night at 87. As a feminist icon and revered jurist, RBG's death was devastating for many, but it \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/21446256/ruth-bader-ginsburg-death-supreme-court-obamacare-case?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso raised\u003c/a\u003e some cold hard political questions about the court’s future makeup. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eGinsburg’s death leaves the court with five conservative-leaning justices and three liberal ones. President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/sep/20/trump-vows-to-nominate-a-woman-for-us-supreme-court-vacancy-within-a-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e Saturday that he’ll nominate a replacement this week. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has promised a confirmation vote. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDemocrats responded with a resounding “Oh, that’s rich,” pointing to McConnell’s refusal in 2016 to hold a hearing for then-President Barack Obama’s nominee, Merrick Garland, because it was an election year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump has pledged to nominate a woman—possibly Amy Coney Barrett, Barbara Lagoa, or Allison Jones Rushing, according to reports. You can read up on them \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/09/19/trump-supreme-court-candidates-418366?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOne upcoming case looms especially large: The ACA \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAka Obamacare. On Nov. 10, one week after the election, the Supreme Court will hear oral arguments in a lawsuit against the healthcare law—a group of Republican-led states is trying to get the ACA thrown out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTheir argument? A provision in the 2017 tax cuts repealed the ACA’s individual mandate penalty (the fine for not having health insurance), so they argue the whole enchilada should be thrown out on grounds of unconstitutionality. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEven if Trump announces an appointee ASAP, it’s unlikely she’ll be confirmed and robed up by the 10th. So with an eight-justice court, a 4-4 tie is possible, in which case it’ll be sent back to lower courts. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Biden campaign is adding the ACA fight to its healthcare-forward message, focusing on Trump’s handling of the pandemic and Biden’s role in getting the ACA passed in the first place. Democratic operatives \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/19/us/politics/joe-biden-supreme-court-ginsburg.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esay\u003c/a\u003e healthcare was a winning issue in the 2018 midterms and has only become more potent now that every stray cough is cause for concern. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday, President Trump gave his “\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/09/20/914032065/tiktok-ban-averted-trump-gives-oracle-walmart-deal-his-blessing?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblessing\u003c/a\u003e” to the marriage of TikTok and major U.S. corporations Oracle and Walmart. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eOracle and Walmart will reportedly take a combined 20% stake in the new company, TikTok Global. ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese owner and the main character in this drama, is expected to keep 80%...but American interests control 40% of ByteDance, so the new company will have \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/19/trump-says-he-has-approved-tiktok-oracle-deal-in-concept.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajority U.S. ownership\u003c/a\u003e, per the Trump administration.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut Trump's original demand for ByteDance to sell TikTok's U.S. operations over national security concerns \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/20/technology/tiktok-trump-victory.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eisn't \u003c/em\u003ehappening\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which leaves some critics asking...\"what was the point of all this again?\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOracle and Walmart are happy: \u003c/strong\u003eOracle will get a big boost to its cloud business, which has lagged rivals like Amazon. Walmart will flex its e-commerce muscles to TikTok’s 100 million monthly active U.S. users.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ethe Commerce Department delayed its order to ban TikTok from U.S. app stores. The other Chinese app under fire, WeChat, was also \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-wechat/u-s-judge-blocks-commerce-department-order-to-remove-wechat-from-app-stores-idUSKCN26B0IY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaved\u003c/a\u003e from an app store ban by a judge yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- The Raiders will break in the stadium (nicknamed the “Death Star”) against the New Orleans Saints on \u003cem\u003eMonday Night Football.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eHosting an NFL team is a landmark moment for Las Vegas, which had a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/13/sports/football/oakland-raiders-las-vegas-stadium.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereputation\u003c/a\u003e for being too tourism-centered and small to support a football franchise. But continued population growth and an up-and-coming tech industry mean it could be ready. The NHL and WNBA both added Vegas outposts in the last few years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/dafc4bfa7f8e9b7796c52455d139df0d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistoric moment\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the NFL, which had shunned any connection to sports betting. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Raiders’ debut comes at a time when Las Vegas’s position atop the (legal) sports betting world is \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/new-jersey-passed-nevada-in-sports-betting-last-month-should-las-vegas-be-worried-2019-11-04?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeing challenged\u003c/a\u003e.
